title.en: Biographies of Fu, Jin, and the Marquis of Kuaicheng
title.raw: 《傅靳蒯成列傳》 Biographies of Fu, Jin, and the Marquis of Kuaicheng

sentences.zh: 陽陵侯傅寬，以魏五大夫騎將從，為舍人，起橫陽。

translations.literal: The Marquis of Yangling, Fu Kuan, followed as a cavalry general of the five great men of Wei. He became a retainer and arose from Hengyang.

sentences.zh: 從攻安陽、杠裏，擊趙賁軍於開封，及擊楊熊曲遇、陽武，斬首十二級，賜爵卿。

translations.literal: He followed in attacking Anyang and Gangli, struck Zhao Fen's army at Kaifeng, and also struck Yang Xiong at Quyu and Yangwu. He beheaded twelve enemies and was granted the marquisate of Qing.

sentences.zh: 從至霸上。

translations.literal: He followed and arrived at Bashang.

sentences.zh: 沛公立為漢王，漢王賜寬封號共德君。

translations.literal: When Pei Gong was established as Han King, the Han King granted Fu Kuan the title Lord Gongde.

sentences.zh: 從入漢中，遷為右騎將。

translations.literal: He followed in entering Hanzhong and was promoted to Right Cavalry General.

sentences.zh: 從定三秦，賜食邑雕陰。

translations.literal: He followed in pacifying the Three Qins and was granted the fief of Diaoyin.

sentences.zh: 從擊項籍，待懷，賜爵通德侯。

translations.literal: He followed in attacking Xiang Ji, waited at Huai, and was granted the marquisate of Tongde Hou.

sentences.zh: 從擊項冠、周蘭、龍且，所將卒斬騎將一人敖下，益食邑。

translations.literal: He followed in attacking Xiang Guan, Zhou Lan, and Long Qu. The troops he led beheaded one cavalry general below Ao, and his fief was increased.

sentences.zh: 屬淮陰，擊破齊歷下軍，擊田解。

translations.literal: He belonged to Huaiyin, struck and broke the Qi army at Lixia, and struck Tian Xie.

sentences.zh: 屬相國參，殘博，益食邑。

translations.literal: He belonged to Chancellor Cao Can, massacred Bo, and his fief was increased.

sentences.zh: 因定齊地，剖符世世勿絕，封為陽陵侯，二千六百戶，除前所食。

translations.literal: Therefore, having pacified Qi territory, he was given a split tally for perpetual inheritance, enfeoffed as Marquis of Yangling with 2,600 households, with previous fiefs eliminated.

sentences.zh: 為齊右丞相，備齊。

translations.literal: He served as Right Chancellor of Qi and defended Qi.

sentences.zh: 五歲為齊相國。

translations.literal: For five years he served as Chancellor of Qi.

sentences.zh: 四月，擊陳豨，屬太尉勃，以相國代丞相噲擊豨。

translations.literal: In the fourth month, he struck Chen Xi, belonged to Grand Commandant Zhou Bo, and as chancellor replaced Chancellor Kuai in striking Xi.

sentences.zh: 一月，徙為代相國，將屯。

translations.literal: In one month, he was transferred to Chancellor of Dai and led the garrison.

sentences.zh: 二歲，為代丞相，將屯。

translations.literal: For two years he served as Chancellor of Dai and led the garrison.

sentences.zh: 孝惠五年卒，謚為景侯。

translations.literal: He died in the fifth year of Xiaohui and was posthumously named Marquis Jing.

sentences.zh: 子頃侯精立，二十四年卒。

translations.literal: His son Marquis Qing Jing succeeded him and died after twenty-four years.

sentences.zh: 子共侯則立，十二年卒。

translations.literal: His son Marquis Gong Ze succeeded him and died after twelve years.

sentences.zh: 子侯偃立，三十一年，坐與淮南王謀反，死，國除。

translations.literal: His son Hou Yan succeeded him. After thirty-one years, he was implicated in plotting rebellion with the King of Huainan, died, and his fief was eliminated.

sentences.zh: 信武侯靳歙，以中涓從，起宛朐。

translations.literal: The Marquis of Xinwu, Jin Xi, followed as an inner attendant and arose from Wanqu.

sentences.zh: 攻濟陽。

translations.literal: He attacked Jiyang.

sentences.zh: 破李由軍。

translations.literal: He broke Li You's army.

sentences.zh: 擊秦軍亳南、開封東北，斬騎千人將一人，首五十七級，捕虜七十三人，賜爵封號臨平君。

translations.literal: He struck the Qin army south of Bo and northeast of Kaifeng, beheaded one commander of a thousand cavalry, took fifty-seven heads, captured seventy-three prisoners, and was granted the marquisate and title Lord Linping.

sentences.zh: 又戰藍田北，斬車司馬二人，騎長一人，首二十八級，捕虜五十七人。

translations.literal: He again battled north of Lantian, beheaded two chariot assistant directors and one cavalry captain, took twenty-eight heads, and captured fifty-seven prisoners.

sentences.zh: 至霸上。

translations.literal: He arrived at Bashang.

sentences.zh: 沛公立為漢王，賜歙爵建武侯，遷為騎都尉。

translations.literal: Pei Gong established as Han King, granted Xi marquisate Jianwu Hou, promoted to cavalry commandant's assistant.
translations.idiomatic: When Pei Gong was established as Han King, he granted Jin Xi the marquisate of Jianwu Hou and promoted him to Cavalry Commandant's Assistant.

sentences.zh: 從定三秦。

translations.literal: He followed in pacifying the Three Qins.

sentences.zh: 別西擊章平軍於隴西，破之，定隴西六縣，所將卒斬車司馬、候各四人，騎長十二人。

translations.literal: He separately struck west against Zhang Ping's army at Longxi, broke it, pacified six counties of Longxi. The troops he led beheaded four chariot assistant directors, four scouts, and twelve cavalry captains.

sentences.zh: 從東擊楚，至彭城。

translations.literal: He followed in striking east against Chu and arrived at Pengcheng.

sentences.zh: 漢軍敗還，保雍丘，去擊反者王武等。

translations.literal: The Han army was defeated and returned, defended Yongqiu, and went to strike the rebels Wang Wu and others.

sentences.zh: 略梁地，別將擊邢說軍菑南，破之，身得說都尉二人，司馬、候十二人，降吏卒四千一百八十人。

translations.literal: Raided Liang land, separately led struck Xing Yue army Zi south, broke it, personally got Yue commandant's assistants two persons, assistant directors, scouts twelve persons, surrendered officials soldiers four thousand one hundred eighty persons.
translations.idiomatic: He raided Liang territory, separately led troops to strike Xing Yue's army south of Zi, broke it. He personally captured two of Yue's commandant's assistants, twelve assistant directors and scouts, and induced the surrender of 4,180 officials and soldiers.

sentences.zh: 破楚軍滎陽東。

translations.literal: He broke the Chu army east of Xingyang.

sentences.zh: 三年，賜食邑四千二百戶。

translations.literal: In the third year, he was granted a fief of 4,200 households.

sentences.zh: 別之河內，擊趙將賁郝軍朝歌，破之，所將卒得騎將二人，車馬二百五十匹。

translations.literal: He separately went to Henan, struck Zhao general Fen Hao's army at Zhaoge, broke it. The troops he led captured two cavalry generals and 250 teams of chariots and horses.

sentences.zh: 從攻安陽以東，至棘蒲，下七縣。

translations.literal: He followed in attacking east of Anyang, arrived at Jipu, and took seven counties.

sentences.zh: 別攻破趙軍，得其將司馬二人，候四人，降吏卒二千四百人。

translations.literal: He separately attacked and broke the Zhao army, capturing two of its assistant directors and four scouts, and inducing the surrender of 2,400 officials and soldiers.

sentences.zh: 從攻下邯鄲。

translations.literal: He followed in attacking and taking Handan.

sentences.zh: 別下平陽，身斬守相，所將卒斬兵守、郡守各一人，降鄴。

translations.literal: He separately took Pingyang, personally beheaded the defending chancellor. The troops he led beheaded one garrison commander and one commandery governor each, and surrendered Ye.

sentences.zh: 從攻朝歌、邯鄲，及別擊破趙軍，降邯鄲郡六縣。

translations.literal: He followed in attacking Zhaoge and Handan, and separately struck and broke the Zhao army, inducing the surrender of six counties of Handan commandery.

sentences.zh: 還軍敖倉，破項籍軍成皋南，擊絕楚馕道，起滎陽至襄邑。

translations.literal: He returned the army to Aocang, broke Xiang Ji's army south of Chenggao, struck and cut off Chu's grain route, from Xingyang to Xiangyi.

sentences.zh: 破項冠軍魯下。

translations.literal: He broke Xiang Guan's army below Lu.

sentences.zh: 略地東至繒、郯、下邳，南至蘄、竹邑。

translations.literal: He raided territory east to Zeng, Tan, and Xiapi, south to Qi and Zhuyi.

sentences.zh: 擊項悍濟陽下。

translations.literal: He struck Xiang Han below Jiyang.

sentences.zh: 還擊項籍陳下，破之。

translations.literal: He returned and struck Xiang Ji below Chen, broke it.

sentences.zh: 別定江陵，降江陵柱國、大司馬以下八人，身得江陵王，生致之雒陽，因定南郡。

translations.literal: He separately pacified Jiangling, inducing the surrender of eight persons including the Pillar of State and Grand Marshal of Jiangling. He personally captured the King of Jiangling, delivered him alive to Luoyang, and thereby pacified Nangun.

sentences.zh: 從至陳，取楚王信，剖符世世勿絕，定食四千六百戶，號信武侯。

translations.literal: He followed and arrived at Chen, took the Chu King Xin, was given a split tally for perpetual inheritance, fixed fief of 4,600 households, and titled Xinwu Hou.

sentences.zh: 以騎都尉從擊代，攻韓信平城下，還軍東垣。

translations.literal: With cavalry commandant's assistant followed struck Dai, attacked Han Xin Pingcheng below, returned army Dongyuan.
translations.idiomatic: As Cavalry Commandant's Assistant he followed in striking Dai, attacked Han Xin below Pingcheng, and returned the army to Dongyuan.

sentences.zh: 有功，遷為車騎將軍，并將梁、趙、齊、燕、楚車騎，別擊陳豨丞相敞，破之，因降曲逆。

translations.literal: For merit, he was promoted to Chariot Cavalry General, combined leading the chariot cavalry of Liang, Zhao, Qi, Yan, and Chu. He separately struck Chen Xi's chancellor Chang, broke him, and thereby surrendered Quni.

sentences.zh: 從擊黥布有功，益封定食五千三百戶。

translations.literal: He followed in striking Qing Bu and had merit, so his enfeoffment was increased to a fixed fief of 5,300 households.

sentences.zh: 凡斬首九十級，虜百三十二人；

translations.literal: Altogether beheaded ninety heads, captured prisoners one hundred thirty-two persons;
translations.idiomatic: Altogether he beheaded ninety heads and captured 132 prisoners;'

sentences.zh: 別破軍十四，降城五十九，定郡、國各一，縣二十三；

translations.literal: Separately broke armies fourteen, surrendered cities fifty-nine, pacified commanderies, states each one, counties twenty-three;
translations.idiomatic: He separately broke fourteen armies, induced the surrender of fifty-nine cities, pacified one commandery and one state each, and twenty-three counties;'

sentences.zh: 得王、柱國各一人，二千石以下至五百石三十九人。

translations.literal: He captured one king and one pillar of state each, and thirty-nine persons from 2,000 shi officials down to 500 shi officials.'

sentences.zh: 高后五年，歙卒，謚為肅侯。

translations.literal: In the fifth year of the Gao Empress Dowager, Jin Xi died and was posthumously named Marquis Su.

sentences.zh: 子亭代侯。

translations.literal: His son Ting succeeded as marquis.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，坐事國人過律，孝文後三年，奪侯，國除。

translations.literal: After twenty-one years, he was implicated in a matter where the people of his state violated the laws. In the third year after Xiaowen's death, his marquisate was stripped and his state eliminated.

sentences.zh: 蒯成侯緤者，沛人也，姓周氏。

translations.literal: The Marquis of Kuaicheng, Zhou Bo, was a man of Pei and of the Zhou clan.

sentences.zh: 常為高祖參乘，以舍人從起沛。

translations.literal: He often served Gaozu as chariot companion and followed him as a retainer when he arose from Pei.

sentences.zh: 至霸上，西入蜀、漢，還定三秦，食邑池陽。

translations.literal: He arrived at Bashang, went west into Shu and Han, returned and pacified the Three Qins, and received the fief of Chiyang.

sentences.zh: 東絕甬道，從出度平陰，遇淮陰侯兵襄國，軍乍利乍不利，終無離上心。

translations.literal: He cut off the eastern Yongdao, followed and emerged crossing Pingyin, encountered the Marquis of Huaiyin's troops at Xiangguo. The army was now advantageous, now disadvantageous, but he finally had no heart that departed from the Sovereign.

sentences.zh: 以『緤為武侯，食邑三千三百戶。

translations.literal: Therefore 'Zhou as Wu Hou, ate fief three thousand three hundred households.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, 'Zhou was made Marquis Wu and given a fief of 3,300 households.'

sentences.zh: 高祖十二年，以緤為蒯成侯，除前所食邑。

translations.literal: In Gaozu's twelfth year, Zhou was made Marquis of Kuaicheng, with previous fiefs eliminated.

sentences.zh: 上欲自擊陳豨，蒯成侯泣曰：「始秦攻破天下，未嘗自行。

translations.literal: Sovereign desired personally strike Chen Xi, Kuaicheng Hou wept said: 'Beginning Qin attacked broke all-under-heaven, never personally went.
translations.idiomatic: When the Sovereign desired to personally strike Chen Xi, the Marquis of Kuaicheng wept and said: 'When Qin began attacking and breaking all under heaven, it never personally went.'

sentences.zh: 今上常自行，是為無人可使者乎？」

translations.literal: Now Sovereign often personally goes, this is because no person can be dispatched?'
translations.idiomatic: Now the Sovereign often goes personally—is this because there is no one who can be dispatched?'

sentences.zh: 上以為「愛我」，賜入殿門不趨，殺人不死。

translations.literal: Sovereign considered 'loves me', granted entered palace gate not hastened, killed person not died.
translations.idiomatic: The Sovereign considered it 'love for me' and granted him entry to the palace gate without hastening, and that killing a person would not be punishable by death.

sentences.zh: 至孝文五年，緤以壽終，謚為貞侯。

translations.literal: In the fifth year of Xiaowen, Zhou Bo died of old age and was posthumously named Marquis Zhen.

sentences.zh: 子昌代侯，有罪，國除。

translations.literal: His son Chang succeeded as marquis, but had a crime and his state was eliminated.

sentences.zh: 至孝景中二年，封緤子居代侯。

translations.literal: In the second year of Xiaojing's reign, Zhou Bo's son Ju was enfeoffed as Marquis of Dai.

sentences.zh: 至元鼎三年，居為太常，有罪，國除。

translations.literal: In the third year of Yuanding, Ju served as Grand Supplicator but had a crime, and his state was eliminated.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：陽陵侯傅寬、信武侯靳歙皆高爵，從高祖起山東，攻項籍，誅殺名將，破軍降城以十數，未嘗困辱，此亦天授也。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: Yangling Hou Fu Kuan, Xinwu Hou Jin Xi both high marquisates, followed Gaozu arose Shandong, attacked Xiang Ji, executed famous generals, broke armies surrendered cities in tens number, never experienced distress humiliation, this also heaven bestowed.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: The Marquis of Yangling Fu Kuan and the Marquis of Xinwu Jin Xi both held high marquisates. They followed Gaozu arising from Shandong, attacked Xiang Ji, executed famous generals, broke armies and induced the surrender of cities numbering in the tens, and never experienced distress or humiliation. This too was heaven's bestowal.

sentences.zh: 蒯成侯周緤操心堅正，身不見疑，上欲有所之，未嘗不垂涕，此有傷心者然，可謂篤厚君子矣。

translations.literal: The Marquis of Kuaicheng Zhou Bo grasped a heart that was firm and upright, his person was never suspected. When the Sovereign desired to go somewhere, he never failed to shed tears. This was the appearance of one who had a wounded heart. He can be called a solid and thick gentleman.
